<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Print out the IR after passes, similar to -print-after-all except that it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only prints the IR after passes that change the IR. Those passes that do not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// make changes to the IR are reported as not making any changes. In addition,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the initial IR is also reported.  Other hidden options affect the output from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this option. -filter-passes will limit the output to the named passes that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// actually change the IR and other passes are reported as filtered out. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// specified passes will either be reported as making no changes (with no IR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reported) or the changed IR will be reported. Also, the -filter-print-funcs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and -print-module-scope options will do similar filtering based on function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// name, reporting changed IRs as functions(or modules if -print-module-scope is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// specified) for a particular function or indicating that the IR has been</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// filtered out. The extra options can be combined, allowing only changed IRs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for certain passes on certain functions to be reported in different formats,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with the rest being reported as filtered out.  The -print-before-changed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// option will print the IR as it was before each pass that changed it. The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// optional value of quiet will only report when the IR changes, suppressing all</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// other messages, including the initial IR. The values &quot;diff&quot; and &quot;diff-quiet&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will present the changes in a form similar to a patch, in either verbose or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// quiet mode, respectively. The lines that are removed and added are prefixed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with &#39;-&#39; and &#39;+&#39;, respectively. The -filter-print-funcs and -filter-passes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can be used to filter the output.  This reporter relies on the linux diff</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// utility to do comparisons and insert the prefixes. For systems that do not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have the necessary facilities, the error message will be shown in place of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the expected output.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;ChangePrinter&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a5074e520089f2472cad6437fe736eef2">llvm::PrintChanged</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
